The magnetic force on the conductor is balanced by the gravitational force.
The tension in the wire is zero, indicating that the magnetic force is the only force acting on the conductor.
The magnetic force is given by \( F = BIL \)
The gravitational force is \( F_g = mg \)
Setting the magnetic force equal to the gravitational force and solving for \( I \) gives \( I = \frac{mg}{BL} \)

Substitute the given values \( m = 10 \text{ g} = 0.01 \text{ kg} \), \( L = 50 \text{ cm} = 0.5 \text{ m} \), \( B = 1.0 \text{ T} \), and \( g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2 \) into the equation to find \( I \).
